DataElement.preferredName: Internal Radiation Therapy Administration Method Type

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Procedure Domain Internal Radiation Therapy Administration Method
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to procedure._A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material sealed in needles, seeds, wires, or catheters is placed directly into or near a tumor._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to procedure.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to procedure.

Property.preferredDefinition: A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material sealed in needles, seeds, wires, or catheters is placed directly into or near a tumor.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

Concepts.definition: A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material is placed inside the body, into a tumor or body cavity.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.
A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released. AK 2020-6-11; Created for CDSIC aligned NCI Standard CRFs. ghd

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the type of delivery method used in brachytherapy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An internal radiation treatment technique in which a piece of thin, flexible mesh made of vicryl and implanted with radioactive seeds is surgically attached to target tissue where it emits a low dose of radiation over a prolonged period of time.

Concepts.definition: An internal radiation treatment technique in which a piece of thin, flexible mesh made of vicryl and implanted with radioactive seeds is surgically attached to target tissue where it emits a low dose of radiation over a prolonged period of time.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 7/13/23 Added missing concept per cleanup activities cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An internal radiation treatment technique in which radioactive seeds are embedded in suture material and directly affixed to target cancerous tissue.

Concepts.definition: An internal radiation treatment technique in which radioactive seeds are embedded in suture material and directly affixed to target cancerous tissue.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 7/12/23 Added missing concept per cleanup activities cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Mesh Radioactive Seed Implant Dosing Unit

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Mesh Radioactive Seed Implant Dosing Unit
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A traditional unit of length defined as the number of opening per inch of a screen, e.g. the number of strands or particles per inch.: A dosing unit in a form of an incapsulated radioactive material that constitutes an implantable pellet designed for brachytherapy administration.

Concepts.definition: A traditional unit of length defined as the number of opening per inch of a screen, e.g. the number of strands or particles per inch.
A dosing unit in a form of an incapsulated radioactive material that constitutes an implantable pellet designed for brachytherapy administration.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dosing unit in a form of an incapsulated radioactive material that constitutes an implantable pellet designed for brachytherapy administration.

Concepts.definition: A dosing unit in a form of an incapsulated radioactive material that constitutes an implantable pellet designed for brachytherapy administration.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A metallic tube that is inserted into the vagina in order to facilitate delivery of vaginal intracavitary radiation therapy.

Concepts.definition: A metallic tube that is inserted into the vagina in order to facilitate delivery of vaginal intracavitary radiation therapy.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 7/7/23 Added missing concept per cleanup activities cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An internal radiation treatment technique in which a small metal tube filled with a radioactive source is placed inside the uterus for the treatment of gynecological cancers.

Concepts.definition: An internal radiation treatment technique in which a small metal tube filled with a radioactive source is placed inside the uterus for the treatment of gynecological cancers.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 7/7/23 Added missing concept per cleanup activities cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An internal radiation treatment technique in which a small diameter hollow metal sphere filled with a radioactive source is placed inside the uterus for the treatment of gynecological cancers.

Concepts.definition: An internal radiation treatment technique in which a small diameter hollow metal sphere filled with a radioactive source is placed inside the uterus for the treatment of gynecological cancers.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 7/7/23 Added missing concept per cleanup activities cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An internal radiation treatment technique in which a small diameter hollow metal sphere filled with a radioactive source is placed inside the uterus for the treatment of gynecological cancers.

Concepts.definition: An internal radiation treatment technique in which a small diameter hollow metal sphere filled with a radioactive source is placed inside the uterus for the treatment of gynecological cancers.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 7/13/23 Added missing concept per cleanup activities cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An internal radiation treatment technique in which a curved, hollow applicator with a rounded reservoir at the tip is inserted into the uterus or cervix and then injected with radioactive sources for the treatment of gynecological cancers.

Concepts.definition: An internal radiation treatment technique in which a curved, hollow applicator with a rounded reservoir at the tip is inserted into the uterus or cervix and then injected with radioactive sources for the treatment of gynecological cancers.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 7/7/23 Added missing concept per cleaning activities cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (ray-dee-AY-shun) A procedure in which radioactive material sealed in needles, seeds, wires, or catheters is placed directly into or near a tumor. Also called brachytherapy, internal radiation, or interstitial radiation.: A sharp pointed device.

Concepts.definition: A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material is placed inside the body, into a tumor or body cavity.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 7/13/23 Added missing concept per cleanup activities cjl.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.origin: ACOSOG CRF:American College of Surgeons Oncology Group Case Report Form
